intro: Erigeron modestus, commonly known as the small fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron modestus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
